imited by a barrier membrane (cross-hatched bar with ends curving to the left). Step II: The
marker  is  specifically  recognized  by  a  receptor  protein  and  the  clathrin  vesicle  (hexagonal
shape) begins to form. Step III: The clathrin vesicle is completed and buds off from the ER mem-
brane. Step IV: The clathrin vesicle crosses the cytoplasm and attaches through another specific
marker to a receptor protein (dark gray box) on the lysosomal membrane and releases its cargo.
